intro: Pleurogyne sikkimensis, commonly known as the Sikkim pleurogyne, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan region. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments at high altitudes. Its leaves are usually lanceolate and arranged alternately along the stem. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
